title: Redmire Force Walk Route

images.title: Gordon Hatton / A corner of Redmire Green
images.caption: A corner of Redmire Green. The village was featured in the BBC television series All Creatures Great and Small, in the episode "Puppy Love", as the location of Darrowby bus stop. The village pub, the Bolton Arms, was also featured in the episode "Beauty of the Beast"

images.title: Andy Waddington / Main drop of Redmire Force
images.caption: Main drop of Redmire Force. Heather Florence running the main drop of Redmire Force in lowish water on a Swaledale Outdoor Club trip. Although this is a nice enough level at which to run the Force, it is a bit low for the rest of the trip from Aysgarth to Wensley.

images.title: Tony Wells / Redmire Force taken from the south bank of the river Ure
images.caption: Redmire Force taken from the south bank of the river Ure

description: This North Yorkshire Dales village is located in beautiful Wensleydale near Castle Bolton and Leyburn. This walk from the village takes you south to visit the Redmire Force Waterfall on the River Ure in beautiful Wensleydale. You start off in the village and follow footpaths and country lanes to Lower Thoresby and Slapestone Wath. Here you can cross the river on a series of stepping stones before turning east to visit the waterfall. It's a very photogonic spot and particularly impressive after rainfall. To extend the walk head north west from the village to visit Bolton Castle. The historic 14th century castle includes lovely gardens, a maze and excellent views from the top.
